intro: Trichera arvensis var. subintegerrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf trichera, is a variant of the annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring slender stems and lanceolate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale green, and arranged in loose clusters at the leaf axils. This plant is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in cultivated fields. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable by its reduced leaf pubescence and distinct floral structure.
